metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1147 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
readfilemap.c in expat before 2.1.0 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (file descriptor consumption) via a large number of crafted XML files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> readfilemap.c isn't used on linux, only unixfilemap.c ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15 ccdm94> cmake 3.20.5 and forward uses expat 2.2.10+.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'code-not-compiled').
apr-util: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'code-not-compiled').
cmake: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'code-not-compiled').
expat package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'code-not-compiled').
smart: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
texlive-bin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'code-not-compiled').
tla package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
xmlrpc-c: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
